segment.source: Learn about the end-to-end process for developing and publishing an app with ads.
segment.target: Learn about the end-to-end process for developing and publishing an app with ads.

segment.source: Workflows for creating apps with ads
segment.target: Workflows for creating apps with ads

segment.source: Workflows for creating apps with ads
segment.target: Workflows for creating apps with ads

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.source: To display ads in your apps, your app needs to be able receive ads from an ad network.
segment.target: To display ads in your apps, your app needs to be able receive ads from an ad network.

segment.source: Microsoft provides a web service that allows Windows app developers to receive ads.
segment.target: Microsoft provides a web service that allows Windows app developers to receive ads.

segment.source: When users click the ad in your app, you (being the publisher of the ad) earn money from the creator of the ads (the advertiser).
segment.target: When users click the ad in your app, you (being the publisher of the ad) earn money from the creator of the ads (the advertiser).

segment.source: The money earned from advertisers is paid to you using your account.
segment.target: The money earned from advertisers is paid to you using your account.

segment.source: The following high-level steps describe the general process of developing and publishing an app with ads.
segment.target: The following high-level steps describe the general process of developing and publishing an app with ads.

segment.source: Development stage:
segment.target: Development stage:

segment.source: Set up your Windows Dev Center account.
segment.target: Set up your Windows Dev Center account.

segment.source: Develop your app using test mode values.
segment.target: Develop your app using test mode values.

segment.source: Ready to release:
segment.target: Ready to release:

segment.source: Configure your app to receive live ads.
segment.target: Configure your app to receive live ads.

segment.source: Submit your app to Windows Dev Center and review performance data.
segment.target: Submit your app to Windows Dev Center and review performance data.

segment.source: For more information about each step, read its corresponding section below.
segment.target: For more information about each step, read its corresponding section below.

segment.source: Set up your Windows Dev Center account
segment.target: Set up your Windows Dev Center account

segment.source: You need to have an account with Windows Dev Center to publish your app and receive ads.
segment.target: You need to have an account with Windows Dev Center to publish your app and receive ads.

segment.source: This is true regardless of whether or not you are using ad mediation.
segment.target: This is true regardless of whether or not you are using ad mediation.

segment.source: Advertising-related app management is also done in Windows Dev Center.
segment.target: Advertising-related app management is also done in Windows Dev Center.

segment.source: If you have used Microsoft pubCenter to manage advertising in your apps, this has been replaced with features in Windows Dev Center
segment.target: If you have used Microsoft pubCenter to manage advertising in your apps, this has been replaced with features in Windows Dev Center

segment.source: To set up your account with Windows Dev Center, visit the home page.
segment.target: To set up your account with Windows Dev Center, visit the home page.

segment.source: Additional information is available at the Windows Dev Center help pages.
segment.target: Additional information is available at the Windows Dev Center help pages.

segment.source: Develop your app using test mode values
segment.target: Develop your app using test mode values

segment.source: Use the instructions in the following walkthroughs to add an AdControl or InterstitialAd to display ads in your app:
segment.target: Use the instructions in the following walkthroughs to add an AdControl or InterstitialAd to display ads in your app:

segment.source: Interstitial Ads
segment.target: Interstitial Ads

segment.source: AdControl in XAML and .NET
segment.target: AdControl in XAML and .NET

segment.source: AdControl in HTML 5 and Javascript
segment.target: AdControl in HTML 5 and Javascript

segment.source: AdControl in Windows Phone Silverlight
segment.target: AdControl in Windows Phone Silverlight

segment.source: When you use an AdControl or InterstitialAd to display ads in your app, you must specify an application ID and ad unit ID in your code to link your app to your Windows Dev Center account and to serve ads.
segment.target: When you use an AdControl or InterstitialAd to display ads in your app, you must specify an application ID and ad unit ID in your code to link your app to your Windows Dev Center account and to serve ads.

segment.source: While you are developing your app, use test application ID and ad unit ID values to see how your app renders ads during testing.
segment.target: While you are developing your app, use test application ID and ad unit ID values to see how your app renders ads during testing.

segment.source: This enables you to see how the app is receiving and rendering advertisements during testing.
segment.target: This enables you to see how the app is receiving and rendering advertisements during testing.

segment.source: For more information, see Test mode values.
segment.target: For more information, see Test mode values.

segment.source: For complete sample projects that demonstrate how to add banner and video interstitial ads to JavaScript/HTML apps and XAML apps using C# and C++, see the advertising samples on GitHub.
segment.target: For complete sample projects that demonstrate how to add banner and video interstitial ads to JavaScript/HTML apps and XAML apps using C# and C++, see the advertising samples on GitHub.

segment.source: Configure your app to receive live ads
segment.target: Configure your app to receive live ads

segment.source: After you finish testing your app and you are ready to submit it to Windows Dev Center, you must update your app code to use application ID and ad unit ID values from the Windows Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: After you finish testing your app and you are ready to submit it to Windows Dev Center, you must update your app code to use application ID and ad unit ID values from the Windows Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: If you try to use test values in your live app, your app will not receive live ads.
segment.target: If you try to use test values in your live app, your app will not receive live ads.

segment.source: For more information, see Set up ad units in your app.
segment.target: For more information, see Set up ad units in your app.

segment.source: Submit your app
segment.target: Submit your app

segment.source: After you complete development of your app, you can publish your app in the Windows Store by using the Windows Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: After you complete development of your app, you can publish your app in the Windows Store by using the Windows Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: In addition to meeting requirements for all apps in the Windows Store, apps that display ads must meet several additional requirements.
segment.target: In addition to meeting requirements for all apps in the Windows Store, apps that display ads must meet several additional requirements.

segment.source: For more information, see Submit an app with ads to the Windows Store.
segment.target: For more information, see Submit an app with ads to the Windows Store.

segment.source: After your app is published and available in the Windows Store, you can review your advertising performance reports in the Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: After your app is published and available in the Windows Store, you can review your advertising performance reports in the Dev Center dashboard.
